result.execSummary:
Alex Melton was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Alex Melton was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex Melton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE appears in person and in custoday w/o counsel.  State appears by Atty Sue Mueller.  DE wishes to waive extradition to the State of Ohio.  Court questions DE on waiver/advises of right to counsel and to contest extradition.  DE waives counsel and extradition.  Court accepts waivers and has DE sign orders.  Court signs orders and matter is complete.
